episode_summary: This Halloween-themed episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" features facts about a swearing mongoose influencing BBC policies, Alistair Crowley's spicy glacier curries, the Yakuza's ban from trick-or-treating, and ghost crabs using stomach teeth to growl.

facts.fact: In the 1930s, the ghost of a swearing mongoose led the BBC to revise its working conditions.
Famous occultist, Alistair Crowley, used to make a curry so hot that he only served it on glaciers, so the diners could use the snow to cool their mouth down afterwards.
Japan's Yakuza have been told they are no longer allowed to join in trick-or-treating.
Ghost crabs use teeth in their stomachs to growl at their enemies.
